I am a Member of Technical Staff at the Centre for AI Research and Excellence (CAIRE) at **[Statistics Canada](https://www.statcan.gc.ca/en/start)**.
I build full-stack AI systems and the evals that make them safe to deploy in confidential-data settings, with a focus on LLM evals, AI safety, and AI security.
My research focus is on developing statistical methods for uncertainty quantification (conformal prediction, prediction-powered inference) and quality assurance of AI systems. 
Prior experience in SWE (full-stack), data engineering, and ML research (details in [my CV](website_docs/hanan-ather-cv.pdf)).
I am also a member of the Office of Responsible AI, where I lead technical reviews of AI systems across government and contribute to AI frameworks and governance guidance for **[UNECE](https://unece.org/statistics)**, **[G7 GovAI](https://impact.canada.ca/en/challenges/g7-govAI)**, and the **[International Statistical Institute (ISI)](https://www.isi-web.org/)**.
